item.title: NeverAwake FLASHBACK launches December 10
item.content:encoded:
NeverAwake FLASHBACK will now for PC via Steam on December 10, publisher Phoenixx and developer Neotro announced. It will support English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options. A demo is now available as part of Steam Next Fest: October 2025 Edition, which runs until October 21.

Here is an overview of the game, via Phoenixx:

About

Here is a new nightmare, reborn as an arcade-like experience.

NeverAwake FLASHBACK is an offshoot of the nightmare action shooter NeverAwake.

NeverAwake is a nightmarish twin-stick shooter with a unique worldview and original game rules, and was awarded the “Vermilion Gate Award” for the most outstanding work at BitSummit X-Roads in 2022.

New Game Rules! A Reborn Roguelite Shooter Based on the Nightmare World of NeverAwake!

The basic specifications of NeverAwake have been retained, but the style of the game is more like an arcade shooter, where players progress through shuffled stages in a random order, selecting weapons and accessories available between each stage, providing a challenge in a short time.

Gabe-chan, an important existence for the main character Rem, will join the game as a partner to protect Rem.

And completely new stages and new bosses have been added!

Plus, long-awaited new accessories!

Combine numerous weapons and accessories to fight off the monsters in your nightmares.

Story

Rem woke up safely from the nightmare.

I was feeling better and spending my days with a peaceful mind.

But then he realized that he was having nightmares every night again…

What could be the cause of the nightmares?

Will Rem be able to wake up again from more nightmares?

Key Features

  • Kick out vegetables, dentists, and other monsters and blow away painful childhood memories!
  • Unique worldview set in a “girl’s nightmare.”
  • Beautiful hand-drawn graphics and animation.
  • Unique game rules, high retryability.
  • Fast-paced gameplay and powerful boss battles.
  • Over 80 levels / dozens of tricky bosses.
  • Numerous weapons and accessories and their combination builds.
  • High storytelling and multiple endings.

What is NeverAwake?

NeverAwake has a unique world view with its high quality hand-drawn graphics and its beautiful animation.

The enemies are not demons… but vegetables and dentists that the girl hates.

Things and creatures that everyone has had a bad experience with at least once become monsters and attack the main character Rem.

Will Rem be able to wake up from his dream again…?

item.title: Homura Hime limited-time demo now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Try out the 3D bullet hell action game until October 21.

A limited-time demo for 3D bullet hell action game Homura Hime is now available for PC via Steam until October 21 as part of Steam Next Fest: October 2025 Edition, publisher PLAYISM and developer Crimson Dusk announced.

Get the latest details below.

Playable Demo available during Steam Next Fest

The demo features a specially selected stage that allows players to experience everything from the game’s core systems to an intense boss battle. Both the stage’s combat and platforming elements are being unveiled for the first time in this demo.

The demo will be available for a limited time only leading up to the game’s full release, so we encourage players to take this opportunity to check it out.

As a demo-exclusive feature, an online ranking “Boss Rush” mode has been implemented, be sure to give it a try and compete for the top spot.

*Please note that as the game is still in development, certain elements may differ from the final version.
*Save data from the demo cannot be carried over to the full version due to differences in specifications.
*The online ranking feature is planned to be available only in the demo.

Stage Showcase

The very first stage of the game is Adashino, a beautiful place surrounded by greenery but covered in graves and Jizo statues. Here, Homura Hime will have to traverse the terrain with all of the basic actions she’s learned. At the end of the stage, she will have to face the archdemon Agasa, who takes the form of a young girl, in a terrifying battle.

Main Japanese Voice Cast

We are excited to announce that Japanese voiceovers will be implemented for the main characters in Homura Hime! While only a portion of the cast is being revealed at this time, we are pleased to introduce the talented voice actors bringing these characters to life.
The demo version also includes character voiceovers, so we invite you to experience their performances first hand!

  • Homura Hime (voiced by Tomori Kusunoki)
  • Ann (voiced by Manaka Iwami)
  • Kushinada (voiced by Saku Mizuno)
  • Agasa (voiced by Hana Hishikawa)
  • Koume (voiced by Chiyo Ousaki)

About Homura Hime

Inspired by Japanese anime, Homura Hime aims to perfect the genre’s expressiveness in a 3D action game that offers exhilarating, intense battles with challenging bullet hell attacks. As Homura Hime, players will purify Archdemons imprisoned by implacable emotions, discovering along the way the truth behind our protagonist as well as the Archdemons.

Use flashy combos while dodging and parrying enemy attacks, and learn new skills and combos for a more varied playstyle.

Homura Hime is due out for PC via Steam this winter.

View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Dementium: The Ward coming to PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Horror first-person shooter finally comes to PC.

atooi will release horror first-person shooter Dementium: The Ward for PC via Steam, the developer announced. A release date was not announced.

Dementium: The Ward first launched for DS on October 31, 2007, followed by 3DS on December 3, 2015, Switch on October 12, 2023, and PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4 on April 19, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via atooi:

Classic DS horror reborn. Step into the twisted halls of Dementium: The Ward, the cult classic survival horror that redefined handheld terror, now remastered for PC.

Awakening alone in a derelict hospital with no memory of how you got there, you’ll confront grotesque creatures, unravel a chilling mystery, and struggle to survive with nothing but improvised weapons and your wits. Every flicker of light, every echo in the corridor, every drop of blood tells a story you won’t forget.

Originally a groundbreaking horror experience on the Nintendo DS, Dementium: The Ward has been reborn for a new generation with enhanced visuals, smoother controls, and the same relentless atmosphere that made it infamous. Equal parts survival challenge and psychological nightmare, it’s a journey into darkness that fans of Silent Hill and Amnesia cannot miss.

Will you escape the ward… or will you be consumed by it?
